https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/
<h1 class="cdo-hero__title">Make your words meaningful</h1>
</div>
<div class="cdo-hero__caption">
<div class="contain">
<i>i</i><span>Rafe Swan/Cultura/Getty</span>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cdo-search__mega-menu__col1">
<div class="h2 js-toggle" data-is-basic="1" data-target-selector="#megaMenuRecent">Recent and Recommended</div>
<div id="megaMenuRecent" class="cdo-search__mega-menu__links">

</div>
<div class="h2 js-toggle" data-is-basic="1" data-target-selector="#megaMenuDefinition">Definitions and Grammar</div>
<div id="megaMenuDefinition" class="cdo-search__mega-menu__links">
<p>Clear explanations of natural written and spoken English</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english" title="Cambridge English Dictionary">English</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="learner-english" title="Learner’s Dictionary">Learner’s Dictionary</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="essential-british-english" title="Essential British English Dictionary">Essential British English</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="essential-american-english" title="Essential American English Dictionary">Essential American English</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="british-grammar" title="Grammar">Grammar</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cdo-search__mega-menu__col2">
<div class="h2 js-toggle" data-is-basic="1" data-target-selector="#megaMenuTranslation">Translation</div>
<div id="megaMenuTranslation" class="cdo-search__mega-menu__links">
<div class="h3">Bilingual Dictionaries</div>
<p>Click on the arrows to change the translation direction.</p>
<ul>
<li>
<span class="bilingual-switch pointer js-toggle-children" data-target-selector="next" title="Change language direction"><i class="fcdo fcdo-exchange fcdo--nudge" aria-hidden="true"></i></span>

English–Spanish</a>
Spanish–English</a>
</span>
</li>

English–Italian</a>

<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english-arabic" title="Cambridge English-Arabic Dictionary">English–Arabic</a></li>

<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english-chinese-traditional" title="Cambridge English-Chinese (Traditional) Dictionary">English–Chinese (Traditional)</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english-korean" title="Cambridge English-Korean Dictionary">English–Korean</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english-malaysian" title="English-Malay Dictionary">English–Malay</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english-russian" title="Cambridge English-Russian Dictionary">English–Russian</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="english-thai" title="English-Thai Dictionary">English–Thai</a></li>
<li><a href="#" data-dictCode="turkish" title="English-Turkish Dictionary, İngilizce-Türkçe Çeviri">English–Turkish</a></li>

</ul>

<div id="page-content" class="cdo-tpl__z cdo-tpl-alt__z1" role="main">
<h1>Grammar</h1>
<div class="mod mod--flush mod-toc grammar-toc">
<div class="h3 txt-block flush">
<b>Table of contents</b>
</div>
<ul>
<li class="section">
<a>Adjectives and adverbs</a>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/about-adjectives-and-adverbs">about adjectives and adverbs</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/adjectives">adjectives</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/adjective-and-adverb-phrases">adjective and adverb phrases</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/common-adverbs">common adverbs</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/comparatives-and-superlatives">comparatives and superlatives</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/adverbs-of-degree">adverbs of degree</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/adverbs-of-place-and-movement">adverbs of place and movement</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/adverbs-of-time-and-frequency">adverbs of time and frequency</a>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="section">
<a>Easily confused words</a>
<ul>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/above-or-over"><i>Above</i> or <i>over?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/across-over-or-through"><i>Across</i>, <i>over</i> or <i>through</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/advice-or-advise"><i>Advice</i> or <i>advise</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/affect-or-effect"><i>Affect</i> or <i>effect</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/all-or-every"><i>All</i> or <i>every</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/all-or-whole"><i>All</i> or <i>whole</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/allow-permit-or-let"><i>Allow</i>, <i>permit</i> or <i>let</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/almost-or-nearly"><i>Almost</i> or <i>nearly</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/alone-lonely-or-lonesome"><i>Alone</i>, <i>lonely</i>, or <i>lonesome</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/along-or-alongside"><i>Along</i> or <i>alongside</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/already-still-or-yet"><i>Already</i>, <i>still</i> or <i>yet</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/also-as-well-or-too"><i>Also</i>, <i>as well</i> or <i>too</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/alternate-ly-alternative-ly"><i>Alternate(ly)</i>, <i>alternative(ly)</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/although-or-though"><i>Although</i> or <i>though</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/altogether-or-all-together"><i>Altogether</i> or <i>all together</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/amount-of-number-of-or-quantity-of"><i>Amount of</i>, <i>number of</i> or <i>quantity of</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/any-more-or-anymore"><i>Any more</i> or <i>anymore</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/anyone-anybody-or-anything"><i>Anyone</i>, <i>anybody</i> or <i>anything</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/apart-from-or-except-for"><i>Apart from</i> or <i>except for</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/arise-or-rise"><i>Arise</i> or <i>rise</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/around-or-round"><i>Around</i> or <i>round</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/arouse-or-rouse"><i>Arouse</i> or <i>rouse</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-or-like"><i>As</i> or <i>like</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-because-or-since"><i>As</i>, <i>because</i> or <i>since</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-when-or-while"><i>As</i>, <i>when</i> or <i>while</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/been-or-gone"><i>Been</i> or <i>gone</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/begin-or-start"><i>Begin</i> or <i>start</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/beside-or-besides"><i>Beside</i> or <i>besides</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/between-or-among"><i>Between</i> or <i>among</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/born-or-borne"><i>Born</i> or <i>borne</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/bring-take-and-fetch"><i>Bring</i>, <i>take</i> and <i>fetch</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/can-could-or-may"><i>Can</i>, <i>could</i> or <i>may</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/classic-or-classical"><i>Classic</i> or <i>classical?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/come-or-go"><i>Come</i> or <i>go?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/consider-or-regard"><i>Consider</i> or <i>regard</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/consist-comprise-or-compose"><i>Consist</i>, <i>comprise</i> or <i>compose</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/content-or-contents"><i>Content</i> or <i>contents?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/different-from-different-to-or-different-than"><i>Different from</i>, <i>different to</i> or <i>different than</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/do-or-make"><i>Do</i> or <i>make</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/down-downwards-or-downward"><i>Down, downwards or <i>downward?</i></i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/during-or-for"><i>During</i> or <i>for?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/each-or-every"><i>Each</i> or <i>every</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/east-or-eastern-north-or-northern"><i>East</i> or <i>eastern</i>; <i>north</i> or <i>northern</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/economic-or-economical"><i>Economic</i> or <i>economical</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/efficient-or-effective"><i>Efficient</i> or <i>effective</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/elder-eldest-or-older-oldest"><i>Elder</i>, <i>eldest</i> or <i>older</i>, <i>oldest</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/end-or-finish"><i>End</i> or <i>finish</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/especially-or-specially"><i>Especially</i> or <i>specially</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/every"><i>Every one</i> or <i>everyone</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/except-or-except-for"><i>Except</i> or <i>except for</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/expect-hope-or-wait"><i>Expect</i>, <i>hope</i> or <i>wait</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/experience-or-experiment"><i>Experience</i> or <i>experiment</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/fall-or-fall-down"><i>Fall</i> or <i>fall down</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/far-or-a-long-way"><i>Far</i> or <i>a long way</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/farther-farthest-or-further-furthest"><i>Farther</i>, <i>farthest</i> or <i>further</i>, <i>furthest</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/fast-quick-or-quickly"><i>Fast</i>, <i>quick</i> or <i>quickly</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/fell-or-felt"><i>Fell</i> or <i>felt</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/female-or-feminine-male-or-masculine"><i>Female</i> or <i>feminine</i>; <i>male</i> or <i>masculine</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/finally-at-last-lastly-or-in-the-end"><i>Finally</i>, <i>at last</i>, <i>lastly</i> or <i>in the end?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/first-firstly-or-at-first"><i>First</i>, <i>firstly</i> or <i>at first</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/fit-or-suit"><i>Fit</i> or <i>suit</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/following-or-the-following"><i>Following</i> or <i>the following</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/for-or-since"><i>For</i> or <i>since</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/forget-or-leave"><i>Forget</i> or <i>leave</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/full-or-filled"><i>Full</i> or <i>filled</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/fun-or-funny"><i>Fun</i> or <i>funny</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/get-or-go"><i>Get</i> or <i>go?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/grateful-or-thankful"><b tag="b"><i>Grateful</i> or <i>thankful</i>?</b></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/hear-or-listen-to"><i>Hear</i> or <i>listen (to)</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/high-or-tall"><i>High</i> or <i>tall</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/historic-or-historical"><i>Historic</i> or <i>historical</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/house-or-home"><i>House</i> or <i>home</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/how-is-or-what-is-like"><i>How is …?</i> or <i>What is … like?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/if-or-when"><i>If</i> or <i>when</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/if-or-whether"><i>If</i> or <i>whether</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/ill-or-sick"><i>Ill</i> or <i>sick</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/imply-or-infer"><i>Imply</i> or <i>infer</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/in-the-way-or-on-the-way"><i>In the way</i> or <i>on the way</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/its-or-its"><i>It’s</i> or <i>its</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/late-or-lately"><i>Late</i> or <i>lately</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/lay-or-lie"><i>Lay</i> or <i>lie</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/lend-or-borrow"><i>Lend</i> or <i>borrow</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/less-or-fewer"><i>Less</i> or <i>fewer</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/look-at-see-or-watch"><i>Look at</i>, <i>see</i> or <i>watch</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/low-or-short"><i>Low</i> or <i>short</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/man-mankind-or-people"><i>Man</i>, <i>mankind</i> or <i>people</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/maybe-or-may-be"><i>Maybe</i> or <i>may be</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/maybe-or-perhaps"><i>Maybe</i> or <i>perhaps</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/nearest-or-next"><i>Nearest</i> or <i>next</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/never-or-not-ever"><i>Never</i> or <i>not … ever?</i></a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/nice-or-sympathetic"><i>Nice</i> or <i>sympathetic</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/no-doubt-or-without-doubt"><i>No doubt</i> or <i>without doubt</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/no-or-not"><i>No</i> or <i>not</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/nowadays-these-days-or-today"><i>Nowadays</i>, <i>these days</i> or <i>today</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/open-or-opened"><i>Open</i> or <i>opened</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/opportunity-or-possibility"><i>Opportunity</i> or <i>possibility</i>?</a>

</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/other-others-the-other-or-another"><i>Other</i>, <i>others</i>, <i>the other</i> or <i>another</i>?</a>

<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/right-or-rightly"><i>Right</i> or <i>rightly</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>

</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/say-or-tell"><i>Say</i> or <i>tell</i>?</a>
</li>

</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/sometimes-or-sometime"><i>Sometimes</i> or <i>sometime</i>?</a>

<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/sound-or-noise"><i>Sound</i> or <i>noise</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/speak-or-talk"><i>Speak</i> or <i>talk</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/such-or-so"><i>Such</i> or <i>so</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/there-their-or-theyre"><i>There</i>, <i>their</i> or <i>they’re</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/towards-or-toward"><i>Towards</i> or <i>toward</i>?</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/wait-or-wait-for"><i>Wait</i> or <i>wait for</i>?</a>

</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/worth-or-worthwhile"><i>Worth</i> or <i>worthwhile</i>?</a>
</li>
</ul>
</li>

<div class="pad clrd">
<h2>Popular searches</h2>
<div class="cols cols--half a--rev bigger prefix-float">
<div class="cols__col">
<ul class="unstyled divided flush">
<li>
<span class="prefix">1</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/adverbs-types"><div class="title" tag="div" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-680e">Adverbs: types</div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">2</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/this-that-these-those"><div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141ff2f6710.-383f" tag="div"><i class="i" tag="i">This</i>, <i class="i" tag="i">that</i>, <i class="i" tag="i">these</i>, <i class="i" tag="i">those</i></div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">3</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/especially-or-specially"><div class="title" tag="div" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-9b8"><i class="i" tag="i">Especially</i> or <i class="i" tag="i">specially</i><span class="span pad">?</span></div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">4</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/person-persons-or-people"><div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.715e" tag="div"><i class="i" tag="i">Person</i>, <i class="i" tag="i">persons</i> or <i class="i" tag="i">people</i><span class="span pad">?</span></div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">5</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/future-be-going-to-i-am-going-to-work"><div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.250" tag="div">Future: <i class="i" tag="i">be going to</i> (<i class="i" tag="i">I am going to work</i>)</div></a>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="cols__col">
<ul class="unstyled divided divided--notfirst flush">
<li>
<span class="prefix">6</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/beside-or-besides"><div class="title" tag="div" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-42d7"><i class="i" tag="i">Beside</i> or <i class="i" tag="i">besides</i><span class="span pad">?</span></div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">7</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/above-or-over"><div class="title" tag="div" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-77c2"><i class="i" tag="i">Above</i> or <i class="i" tag="i">over</i><span class="span pad">?</span></div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">8</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/lend-or-borrow"><div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.247a" tag="div"><i class="i" tag="i">Lend</i> or <i class="i" tag="i">borrow</i><span class="span pad">?</span></div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">9</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/discourse-markers-so-right-okay"><div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-18da" tag="div">Discourse markers (<i class="i" tag="i">so, right, okay</i>)</div></a>
</span>
</li>
<li>
<span class="prefix">10</span>
<span class="prefix-item">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/although-or-though"><div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-5851" tag="div"><i class="i" tag="i">Although</i> or <i class="i" tag="i">though</i><span class="span pad">?</span></div></a>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div class="mod mod-browse mod-browse--tall">
<div class="h3 txt-block txt-block--alt flush">
<b>
Browse Grammar                    </b>
</div>

<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/arouse-or-rouse" title='Arouse or rouse? definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-5083"><i class="i">Arouse</i> or <i class="i">rouse</i><span class="span">?</span></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/arrive" title='Arrive definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-5067"><i class="i">Arrive</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as" title='As definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-5045"><i class="i">As</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-as" title='As … as definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4fa0"><i class="i">As</i> … <i class="i">as</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-if-and-as-though" title='As if and as though definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4f20"><i class="i">As if</i> and <i class="i">as though</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-long-as-and-so-long-as" title='As long as and so long as definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4ed5"><i class="i">As long as</i> and <i class="i">so long as</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-or-like" title='As or like? definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4ea5"><i class="i">As</i> or <i class="i">like</i><span class="span">?</span></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-well-as" title='As well (as) definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4e48"><i class="i">As well (as)</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-because-or-since" title='As, because or since? definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4dff"><i class="i">As</i>, <i class="i">because</i> or <i class="i">since</i><span class="span">?</span></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/as-when-or-while" title='As, when or while? definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4d46"><i class="i">As</i>, <i class="i">when</i> or <i class="i">while</i><span class="span">?</span></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/ask-and-ask-for" title='Ask and ask for definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4c93"><i class="i">Ask</i> and <i class="i">ask for</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/at" title='At definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4c3a"><i class="i">At</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/at-all" title='At all definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4b3a"><i class="i">At all</i></div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/at-in-and-to-movement" title='At, in and to (movement) definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4af3"><i class="i">At</i>, <i class="i">in</i> and <i class="i">to</i> (movement)</div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/at-on-and-in-place" title='At, on and in (place) definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4aab"><i class="i">At</i>, <i class="i">on</i> and <i class="i">in</i> (place)</div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/at-on-and-in-time" title='At, on and in (time) definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-4a29"><i class="i">At</i>, <i class="i">on</i> and <i class="i">in</i> (time)</div>
</a>
</li>
<li>
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/away-and-away-from" title='Away and away from definition in Grammar'>
<div class="title" url="u92b9df159e5602a6.-57996681.141fd70d9ad.-48b0"><i class="i">Away</i> and <i class="i">away from</i></div>
</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id='ad_btmslot_a' class='am-default '>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cdo-tpl__z cdo-tpl-alt__z2 cdo-tpl-alt__z2--retract">
<div class="mod mod--dark mod--style1">
<div class="pad">
<p class="leader">Create and share your own word lists and quizzes for free!</p>
<p>
<a class="btn btn--white btn--s13 registerBtn"><b>Sign up now</b></a>
<a class="btn btn--impact2 btn--s13 loginBtn"><b>Log in</b></a>
</p>
</div>
</div>
<div id='ad_rightslot' class='am-default '>
</div>
<div class="mod mod--dark mod--style2 oflow-hide">
<div class="pad">
<p class="h2 semi-flush alt">Word of the Day</p>
<p class="h4 feature-w-big wotd-hw">taro</p><p>a tropical plant that has a root that is cooked and eaten</p>
</div>
<div class="txt-block txt-block--alt with-icons js-eqh-sticky">
<div class="with-icons__content">
<a href="https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/taro" class="a--rev a--b">
<span>About this</span> <i class="fcdo fcdo-angle-right" aria-hidden="true"></i>
</a>
</div>

<small class="smaller"><time>September 24, 2018</time></small>
